definition: This tool lets you paint on an image with different shapes, sizes and opacities. It is often used to apply colors, shadows and textures.
This tool fills a closed area of the same color with the currently selected color. Useful for quickly adding color to a specific area.
These tools can be used to select rectangular or elliptical shapes. They are used to isolate a specific part of an image.
This tool selects areas of similar color according to a tolerance threshold. It is useful for selecting areas of homogeneous color.
Also known as a 'duplication stamp', this tool allows you to copy part of an image for reproduction elsewhere. Useful for eliminating imperfections or duplicating elements.
As its name suggests, this tool erases parts of the image. It can be used to correct errors or adjust specific areas.
This tool creates a gradient of colors between two points. It is often used to create background or transition effects.
Definition: This tool lets you add text to an image. You can customize the font, size and color of the text.
The zoom tool allows you to move the view closer to or further away from the image. It is essential for working on fine details.
This tool lets you scroll the image when it's enlarged, making it easier to navigate and manipulate details.
